streams.help: comma-separated strings of tap stream IDs

url.help: REST API endpoint with {params}. Required in config.

auth_method.help: HTTP request authentication method: no_auth, basic or digest

http_headers.help: JSON-format string of HTTP request headers key-value pairs

username.help: username used for authentication if applicable

password.help: password used for authentication if applicable

offset_start.help: Specify the initial value of current_offset

page_start.help: Specify the initial value of current_page

timestamp_key.help: POSIX timestamp key(column) name. If this is not null, timestamp_key is ignored

end_timestamp.help: End POSIX timestamp. When this is set, tap only replicates the record with end_timestamp younger than end_timestamp. Once equal or greater than end_datetime is read, the process exits.

datetime_key.help: Datetime key(column) name. If this is not null, timestamp_key is ignored

start_datetime.help: Start datetime in ISO 8601 format. As a convenience, this will be automatically converted to timestamp if datetime_key is null and timestamp_key is set and start_timestamp is null.

end_datetime.help: End datetime in ISO 8601 format. When this is set, tap only replicates the record with datetime younger than end_datetime.  Once equal or greater than end_datetime is read, the process exits. As a convenience, this will be automatically converted to timestamp if datetime_key is null and timestamp_key is set and end_timestamp is null.

end_index.help: When this is set, tap only replicates the record with index younger than end_index. Once equal or greater than end_index is read, the process exits.

items_per_page.help: # of items per page if API supports paging

assume_sorted.help: If true, trust the source data to be presorted by the index/timestamp/datetime keys. So it is safe to finish the replication once the last update index/timestamp/datetime passes the end.

max_page.help: If set, stop polling after max_page

filter_by_schema.help: Filter the records read from the source according to schema. Any fields not present in shema will be removed.

record_list_level.help: Set this like 'level_1,level_2...' if the target list is at raw_json_response[level_1][level_2]...

record_level.help: Set this like 'level_a,level_b...' if the target object is at raw_individual_record[level_a][level_b]...
